verses.roman:
tomāra kavitva yena gaṅgā-jala-dhāra
tomā-sama kavi kothā nāhi dekhi āra

synonyms: tomāra—your; kavitva—poetic ingenuity; yena—like; gaṅgā-jala-dhāra—the flowing of the waters of the Ganges; tomā-sama—like you; kavi—poet; kothā—anywhere; nāhi—not; dekhi—I see; āra—anyone else.
translation: "Your poetic skill is like the constant flow of the waters of the Ganges. I find no one in the world who can compete with you.
